name: Prigwort
tagline: Famed brewing and market town in the heart of the Wood
description: Situated in a hilly clearing in the deep woods, Prigwort is a market town famed for its breweries, inns, and taverns. Within the confines of the town wall, twisting alleys and crooked stairways weave between quaint wooden cottages and high-gabled inns, all decorated with colourful, pseudo-heraldic imagery and elaborate wood carving.
atmosphere: Bustling market town atmosphere with brewing culture dominating daily life
inhabitants_description: A large majority of folk of Prigwort origin, together with a smattering of travellers and traders who wandered this way and decided to remain.

governance.political_status: sees to the day-to-day running of Prigwort, as representatives of Lady Harrowmoor
governance.notes: The council also (in secret) pays fealty to the fairy Earl of Yellow, under whose protection Prigwort lies

religion.religious_practices: It is said (by outsiders) that Prigwort folk glorify ale above all. In reality, it would be fair to say that the church and the tavern share equal space in their hearts.

history: The Seven Noble Brewing Houses have dominated Prigwort culture for generations
The old Swinney Tower was once important but fell into disuse
Swinney Road was once an important pilgrimage route to the Abbey of St Clewyd
current_events: Bands of crookhorns and other monsters have recently begun encroaching on the woods close to Prigwort
Lady Harrowmoor is overseeing the establishment of a fortified garrison in Prigwort as a precaution against war
The old Swinney Tower is now reoccupied

special_features.name: Secret Congress with the Earl of Yellow
special_features.description: The brewmasters pay tribute to the Earl in the form of Prigwort's finest spirituous beverages. In return, the Earl protects the town and supplies fabulous ingredients from Fairy for inclusion in their brews.

special_features.name: The Seven Noble Brewing Houses
special_features.description: All townsfolk are proud members of one of seven noble brewing houses, each with its own insignia, traditional festival garb, and seat on the town council.

special_items: Beers and spirits with magical qualities
equipment_availability.notes: Mounts and hounds are usually only available at the market on Colly

locations.name: Town Hall
locations.description: A large, elaborate building with two pointy ornamental turrets, an ostentatious, portcullised gate, and a profusion of heraldic shields decorating its tiled walls. This is the town hall of Prigwort, seat of the Elevated Council of Brewmasters.
locations.interior: A wide, gloomy hall bedecked with heraldic tapestries bearing the insignias of the seven noble brewing houses and depicting the greatest Elevated Brewmasters of the town's past. When town meetings or legal proceedings are under way, the members of the Elevated Council are seated on wooden thrones upon a dais.
locations.exterior: Large, elaborate building with two pointy ornamental turrets, an ostentatious, portcullised gate, and a profusion of heraldic shields decorating its tiled walls
locations.populace: The Elevated Council of Brewmasters, town guards
locations.atmosphere: Formal seat of power with brewing house heraldry
special_features: Exquisitely stocked cellars with vintage wines, spirits, beers, and ciders
Town gaol and garrison

locations.name: Market Square
locations.description: A cobbled square whose sides are packed with tall, leaning stores and public houses. Bustling markets are held here twice a week.
locations.exterior: Cobbled square with tall, leaning stores and public houses
locations.atmosphere: Bustling commercial center

services.name: Colly Market
services.description: Livestock and crafts market
services.notes: Vehicles, mounts, hounds, tools, adventuring gear, and basic weapons and armour

services.name: Frisk Market
services.description: Lively food market with festive music
services.cost: 1d4sp per portion of fungi, 2sp per pastry
services.notes: Three randomly selected types of edible fungi, fancy pastries from hex 1206

special_features: Markets held twice weekly

locations.name: The Oaf in the Oast
locations.description: An old oast-house converted into a heaving tavern affiliated with House Ogsbody. The exterior walls are coated in once bright primary colours, now obscured by layers of thick varnish.
locations.interior: An arc-shaped mahogany bar in the cramped roundel is where most serious drinking takes place. On warm nights the cowl in the lofty roof is opened, allowing nightly zephyrs to sweep away the fust and fug.
locations.exterior: Old oast-house with walls coated in once bright primary colours, now obscured by thick varnish. Various terracotta pots fashioned as hog-like creatures, trailing brittle vines and dead flowers
locations.populace: A bustle of bawdy locals, mostly manual labourers
locations.atmosphere: Rough working-class tavern with no tolerance for fancy folk

services.name: Food
services.description: Of common quality

services.name: Heggid's Bitter
services.description: Two-pint ceramic steins worked into faces of rosy-cheeked barmaids

services.name: Baths
services.description: In the basement, minimum four people
services.cost: 1sp per person (Heggid), 1gp per person (Gawda or Blessie)

special_features: Grimalkins welcomed but treated like dogs and cats
Patrons in fancy attire may be barred

locations.name: Brandybile's
locations.description: This beautifully lacquered but otherwise inconspicuous shop is the premises of a high-class tailor of great repute.
locations.interior: A series of elegantly appointed chambers containing the workshops, display racks, and boudoirs of this high-class tailor. Lit by candles that flicker on and off as clients walk between rooms.
locations.exterior: Beautifully lacquered but inconspicuous with a small, red-painted doorway with shiny brass knob and plaque
locations.atmosphere: Exclusive, magical high-end tailoring establishment

services.name: Fine Clothing
services.description: Tailoring of fancy outfits

services.name: Embroidery
services.description: Enhancement of existing clothing with emblems, coats of arms

services.name: Enchantments
services.description: Clothing suitable for enchantment or direct commission
services.cost: double normal cost for suitable clothing

special_features: By appointment only
Warded by sorcery - theft causes hog transformation curse
secrets: Affiliate of the Shadow House, Castle Brackenwold

locations.name: Raptappen's Quadrant
locations.description: A squat building of black timber with eggshell-coloured trim, surrounding a grassy courtyard in which wavers a single stunted elm. Secure, quiet lodging is on offer here.
locations.interior: Entry hall lined with mossy green carpet and dark wood panelling. Maze of passages leading to private dining rooms. Preternatural calm and quiet throughout.
locations.exterior: Squat building of black timber with eggshell-coloured trim surrounding grassy courtyard with stunted elm
locations.populace: Mysterious guests rarely seen, politely timorous servant lads in rust-coloured livery
locations.atmosphere: Preternatural calm and quiet, mysterious

services.name: Lodgings and Food
services.description: Of common quality

services.name: Wines
services.description: All uncommon wines in stock, 3-in-6 chance of rare wines
services.notes: Proprietor personally brings bottles from cellars

special_features: Private dining rooms for up to fifteen
Courtyard with traditional lawn games

locations.name: The Earl's Court
locations.description: A cobblestoned courtyard featuring a charming fountain, and benches cloistered among rose-clad nooks.
locations.exterior: Cobblestoned courtyard with fountain, benches among rose-clad nooks, golden statue of portly gentleman raising goblet
locations.atmosphere: Charming public space dedicated to the Earl of Yellow
special_features: Golden statue of the fairy Earl of Yellow

locations.name: The Sea of Stars
locations.description: A tall, narrow store, four storeys high, painted with pearls, mermaids, and gaudy nautical scenes.
locations.interior: A luxurious suite, with floral upholstered couches, elegant oil paintings, and display cases of polished, inlaid wood. Grand consulting desk in center.
locations.exterior: Tall, narrow four-storey building painted with pearls, mermaids, and gaudy nautical scenes
locations.atmosphere: Luxurious high-end jewelry establishment

services.name: Gems and Jewelry
services.description: Wide range of decent quality items

special_features: 6 guards with crossbows and swords
Safe room on upper floors

locations.name: The Wrinkled Medlar
locations.description: A three-winged building whose ground floor is constructed of timeworn stone blocks and two upper floors are wood-beamed and painted with murals of the town market. Cultivates the reputation of 'luxury away from home'.
locations.interior: Curated balance between dim, rustic cosiness and timeless elegance. Tables decked with linen, candles, and silver cutlery. Double staircases lead to intimate evening bar overlooking broad stage.
locations.exterior: Three-winged building with stone ground floor and wood-beamed upper floors painted with market murals
locations.populace: Well-to-do merchants, clergy, minor aristocrats with their entourages
locations.atmosphere: Refined luxury establishment with musical performances

services.name: Lodgings and Food
services.description: Of fancy quality

special_features: Strict door policy - no armor or weapons
Finest musical venue in Prigwort
Bardic Guild office behind stage

locations.name: Wyrmspittle the Herbalist
locations.description: An ungainly building teeters on the edge of a small bridge spanning a street below. Prigwort's primary herbalist and apothecary, reached by a steep stair that passes alongside a stinking chicken enclosure.
locations.exterior: Ungainly building on bridge edge, reached by steep stair past chicken enclosure
locations.populace: Customers seeking herbs and alchemical compounds
locations.atmosphere: Eccentric herbalist's establishment

services.name: Herbal Consultation
services.description: Tailored herbal admixtures for extra Hit Point per day of rest

services.name: Mushrooms and Herbs
services.description: Standard items plus rare fungi for trusted customers

services.name: Alchemical Compounds
services.description: Brewmaster's Balsam always in stock, others 2-in-6 chance

locations.name: Church of St Waylaine
locations.description: A rambling structure whose original, narrow nave has been extended over time with many side-chapels in differing styles and antiquities.
locations.interior: Long, narrow nave lined with pillars of gleaming white marble, giving direct view onto altar bathed in coloured light. Enormous bronze statue of St Waylaine depicted as plump woman with seven arms, each bearing an axe. Many side-chapels dedicated to deceased vicars and bishops.
locations.exterior: Rambling structure with extravagant portal framed by seven concentric arches, carved with scenes of angels raising souls to heaven
locations.populace: Brewers wheeling kegs for blessing, pious locals and travellers, the vicar
locations.atmosphere: Sacred space where brewing and religion intersect

services.name: Prayer
services.description: Characters praying may receive blessing of St Waylaine: ability to cast Hold Person

special_features: Walled graveyard warded by the Lichwards
Entrance visible to travellers through Turret Gate

locations.name: The Groaning Gate
locations.description: A squat stone gate topped with a covered wooden lookout post, painted with the image of a sea serpent.
locations.exterior: Squat stone gate with wooden lookout post painted with sea serpent
locations.atmosphere: Fortified entrance to town

locations.name: Turret Gate
locations.description: An ornamental, turreted gate, with portcullis and guard posts. The tops of the turrets stand fully twice the height of the town wall.
locations.exterior: Ornamental turreted gate with portcullis, turrets twice the height of town wall
locations.atmosphere: Grand entrance showing Church of St Waylaine to travelers
special_features: Church entrance visible to travelers passing through

locations.name: Abbey Gate
locations.description: A stone gate topped with a battlement. The gate is flanked on each side by a statue of a bishop.
locations.exterior: Stone gate with battlement, flanked by bishop statues with alms slots
locations.atmosphere: Religious gateway from pilgrimage days

services.name: Alms Collection
services.description: Coins dropped in statue palms go to local church

special_features: Alms boxes in bishop statues

locations.name: The Bagwall
locations.description: A crumbling brick wall that mirrors the course of the main town wall for a quarter of its length. The Bagwall is the remnant of a failed attempt by the semi-mythical Lord Bag-in-Hand to establish a manorial estate in the outskirts of Prigwort.
locations.exterior: Crumbling brick wall mirroring main town wall
locations.atmosphere: Local running joke and historical curiosity
special_features: Local phrase: 'when the Bagwall's finished' means something unlikely to occur

locations.name: Bag Manor
locations.description: A roomy, thatch-roofed residence of several rambling wings. Hereditary home of the wealthy Drouge family, prominent members of the brewing house Oberon.
locations.interior: Octagonal consulting study lined with bookshelves and curio cabinets. Green-stained octagonal desk in centre of carmine rug.
locations.exterior: Roomy, thatch-roofed residence of several rambling wings
locations.populace: Mostlemyre Drouge and three mysterious black-wreathed servitors
locations.atmosphere: Mysterious magical residence

services.name: Detect Magic
services.description: Analysis of items

services.name: Deciphering
services.description: Translation of inscriptions or text

services.name: Magic Item Identification
services.description: Using Drouge's Arcane Unravelling spell

special_features: Book spirit (demi-gnod) in study bookshelves
Takes 1d3 days to gain audience

locations.name: The Clashed Antler
locations.description: A rustic, two-storey building with a thatched roof and sturdy black oak beams, similar in style to Bag Manor. Supposedly located on a site intended for the grounds and outbuildings of Lord Bag-In-Hand's manor.
locations.interior: Grandly rustic, with thick beams, intimately cramped nooks and crannies, comfortingly low ceilings, and a horseshoe bar that looks solid enough to withstand a battering ram.
locations.exterior: Rustic two-storey building with thatched roof and black oak beams
locations.populace: Small number of cringing travellers and locals amid roistering crowd of Austache's Bounders
locations.atmosphere: Rowdy inn dominated by vigilante gang

services.name: Lodgings and Food
services.description: Of common quality

services.name: Private Cottages
services.description: Located in beer garden, accommodate six
services.cost: 1gp per person per night including breakfast

services.name: Bundt Cake
services.description: Immense cake baked twice weekly
services.cost: free to all patrons and passing beggars

special_features: Beer garden with purple and orange lamps
Bounded by Bagwall and bleeds into Dolmenwood

locations.name: Harrow Road
locations.description: A narrow, twisting forest road, just wide enough for a cart at the point where it leaves Prigwort. Harrow Road widens as it winds its way north towards the gates of Harrowmoor Keep.
locations.exterior: Narrow, twisting forest road widening as it goes north
locations.atmosphere: Forest road to the keep

locations.name: Swinney Road
locations.description: A well-maintained, much-frequented trade road that leads from Prigwort to Fort Vulgar. Also once an important pilgrimage route—Swinney Road passes the foot of the (now ruined) Abbey of St Clewyd.
locations.exterior: Well-maintained, much-frequented trade road
locations.atmosphere: Busy trade route with pilgrimage history
special_features: Former pilgrimage route to Abbey of St Clewyd

locations.name: Construction Site
locations.description: Piled beside the wall to the north of the Abbey Gate are rapidly growing heaps of brick, stone, and lumber. This site is being prepared for the construction of a garrison, at the instruction of Lady Harrowmoor and the duke.
locations.exterior: Heaps of brick, stone, and lumber beside the wall
locations.atmosphere: Active military preparation
special_features: Future garrison site

locations.name: Horse-Eye Road
locations.description: A well-maintained, much-frequented trade road that connects Castle Brackenwold and Prigwort.
locations.exterior: Well-maintained, much-frequented trade road
locations.atmosphere: Busy trade route to Castle Brackenwold

npcs.name: Captain Simwise Hogwash
npcs.title: Captain of the Alegard
npcs.description: A bristle-bearded human man in his early sixties, his impeccably polished helmet perpetually strapped upon his shiny bald head. Goggling eyes and a stiff upper lip lend him an astonished appearance at all times.
npcs.dress: Impeccably polished helmet perpetually strapped on bald head
demeanor: always on edge even when drunk
npcs.speech: Gentlemanly. Vacillates between barked orders and mumbled ruminations. Woldish.
desires: Suspects Austache's Bounders of criminal activity, and wishes to arrest Austache and shut down the vigilante gang
npcs.occupation: Level 6 Fighter, Captain of town guards

known_topics.content: The captain speaks gravely of increased crookhorn activity in the surrounding woods. Lady Harrowmoor has ordered construction of a garrison.
The captain's eye twitches. 'Those ruffians! They call themselves vigilantes but I suspect criminal activity. Mark my words, I'll have that Austache in irons.'
He straightens proudly. 'Lady Harrowmoor herself oversees our garrison construction. Prigwort will be well-defended when the time comes.'

secret_info.content: The captain has collected circumstantial evidence of the Bounders engaging in 'protection' schemes with local merchants.
secret_info.hint: He mutters about having 'documentation' that will soon bring Austache down.

relationships.description: Suspects Austache of criminal activity and seeks his arrest

triggers.npc_response: Ah, you serve Lady Harrowmoor? Then we are comrades in arms.

npcs.name: Heggid Axminster
npcs.title: Oaf in the Oast Proprietor
npcs.description: A barrel-chested, lantern-jawed human man in his forties, with hairy forearms and a thatch of matted blonde hair. Broken teeth and nose do not detract from an almost noble carriage in the swing of his proud beer gut.
npcs.dress: Working clothes befitting a tavern keeper
demeanor: attempts to conceal scheming and sly intellect with feigned absent-mindedness
desires: Scheming to set up a clandestine distillery in his cellars—out of sight of the meddling of the Brewmasters and their tax collectors—and start exporting cheap liquor to Dreg
To show his mettle defending Prigwort from any hypothetical invader

known_topics.content: Heggid gestures proudly at his establishment. 'Best bitter in Prigwort, brewed by House Ogsbody. No fancy folk here—just honest workers.'
He spits. 'The Brewmasters and their tax collectors—always taking their cut. A man can barely make an honest living.'
His chest swells. 'If crookhorns come to our gates, they'll find Heggid Axminster ready to fight. I'd show my mettle, I would.'

secret_info.content: Heggid is planning to set up a clandestine distillery in his cellars, hidden from the Brewmasters' tax collectors. He wants to export cheap liquor to Dreg.
secret_info.hint: He sometimes glances toward the cellar door with a scheming look, muttering about 'future investments.'

npcs.name: Algenon Brandybile
npcs.title: Brandybile's Proprietor
npcs.description: A weaselly human man in his forties, always dressed to the height of fashion, with curl-toed moccasins and a moustache to match.
npcs.dress: Always dressed to the height of fashion, with curl-toed moccasins and matching moustache
demeanor: fawning and sycophantic to the right breed of customer
condescending and abrupt to the wrong sort
npcs.mannerisms: May be brought around if his expert opinion on fashion is deferred to
npcs.speech: Obsequious whine. Woldish, basic Old Woldish.
desires: To see Cantius Croupe—his arch-rival and chief boudoir-ward of the duke—ridiculed and deposed

known_topics.content: Algenon examines you critically. 'Fine clothing starts at fifty gold. Embroidery from twenty-five. I also have... special arrangements for enchanted garments.'
His face twists with disgust. 'Cantius Croupe—the duke's boudoir-ward—that pretentious fool knows nothing of true fashion. I dream of seeing him humiliated.'

secret_info.content: Brandybile's is an affiliate of the Shadow House in Castle Brackenwold. Through these contacts, he can arrange for clothing suitable for enchantment.
secret_info.hint: He occasionally mentions having 'connections' for special commissions.

npcs.name: Aspith Raptappen
npcs.title: Raptappen's Proprietor
npcs.description: A sighing human woman in her 50s, of gaunt, saturnine aspect, appearing of noble parentage. Dresses in sombre black suits and smells strongly of mothballs.
npcs.dress: Sombre black suits, smells strongly of mothballs
demeanor: bows scrapingly low to even the lowliest beggar
will often enquire with genuine curiosity of adventurers' recent brushes with death
npcs.speech: Sombre. Given to maudlin proverbs. Woldish, Old Woldish.
desires: Knowledge of what lies beyond death
To host Lady Harrowmoor in the inn

known_topics.content: Aspith bows low. 'Welcome to Raptappen's Quadrant. Quiet, secure lodging. We have wines of exceptional quality—I personally fetch them from the cellars.'
She leans forward with genuine interest. 'Tell me—in your adventures, have you glimpsed what lies beyond death? I seek knowledge of that final mystery.'
She sighs wistfully. 'To host Lady Harrowmoor herself... that would be the greatest honor. Perhaps one day she will grace our humble establishment.'

npcs.name: Hague Jerricorn
npcs.title: Sea of Stars Proprietor
npcs.description: A human woman in her late thirties with cool grey eyes, straight red hair to her waist, and a birth mark across her left eye and cheek. Dresses in an odd mélange of courtly gowns and utilitarian artisan's apron.
npcs.dress: Odd mélange of courtly gowns and utilitarian artisan's apron
demeanor: the grace and poise of a dancer
npcs.mannerisms: Grace and poise of a dancer
desires: The treasure hoard her grandfather (who founded the Sea of Stars) claims to have buried on a remote island in his seafaring days. She has a map
secrets: Has a map to grandfather's treasure hoard

known_topics.content: Hague gestures elegantly at her display cases. 'Gems and jewelry of the finest quality. I also buy treasure—no questions asked about provenance.'
Her eyes sparkle with barely contained excitement. 'I envy you adventurers—the excitement, the danger, the romance of it all. Sometimes I dream of leaving this shop behind.'

secret_info.content: Hague possesses a map to a treasure hoard her grandfather—the founder of the Sea of Stars—claims to have buried on a remote island during his seafaring days.
secret_info.hint: She sometimes argues with sailors about old maps and distant islands.

secret_info.content: Hague possesses a Ring of Invisibility, which she keeps hidden among her personal jewelry.
secret_info.hint: She occasionally touches a particular ring on her finger with a knowing smile.

npcs.name: Maydrid Hydball
npcs.title: Wrinkled Medlar Proprietor
npcs.description: A tall, slender human woman of great beauty in her late 20s, with cropped brown hair and a scintillating smile. Dresses in simple scarlet gowns and gold earrings.
npcs.dress: Simple scarlet gowns and gold earrings
demeanor: charmingly informal, even with those of noble birth
desires: To convince her staid brothers to open a ballroom in the inn's attic
For her lover—the bard Gherigew Thorncripe (see hex 0604)—to forsake the life of a wanderer and settle in Prigwort
secrets: Has a lover, the wandering bard Gherigew Thorncripe

known_topics.content: Maydrid beams warmly. 'The Wrinkled Medlar offers luxury away from home. Our evening entertainment features the finest musicians in Prigwort—no weapons or armor inside, I'm afraid.'
She sighs. 'I so wish to convince my brothers to open a ballroom in the attic. Can you imagine the dances we could hold?'

secret_info.content: Maydrid has a secret lover—the wandering bard Gherigew Thorncripe. She desperately wishes he would settle in Prigwort.
secret_info.hint: Her eyes grow distant when bards perform, and she occasionally mentions a 'dear friend' who travels.

relationships.description: Kneeve desperately pursues her hand in marriage, but Maydrid has no time for the smarmy bard

npcs.name: Sprewdiman Kneeve
npcs.title: Bardic Guild Delegate
npcs.description: A bulky, rat-faced human man in his thirties, with a powdered wig and a brass-knobbed walking cane. As Prigwort delegate of the Bardic Guild, Kneeve is an expert on matters musical and is himself a virtuoso violinist (but stage fright prevents him performing).
npcs.dress: Powdered wig and brass-knobbed walking cane
demeanor: expresses himself with swishes of his silk handkerchief
desires: The hand of Maydrid Hydball in marriage. (Maydrid has no time for the smarmy Kneeve.)
secrets: Stage fright prevents him from performing despite being a virtuoso violinist

known_topics.content: Sprewdiman swishes his handkerchief. 'As Prigwort delegate of the Bardic Guild, I am the foremost authority on matters musical. The Wrinkled Medlar hosts only the finest performers.'
He gazes longingly toward the bar. 'Maydrid Hydball—is she not the most radiant creature? I shall win her heart, I am certain of it.'

secret_info.content: Despite being a virtuoso violinist, Sprewdiman suffers from crippling stage fright that prevents him from ever performing publicly.
secret_info.hint: He nervously changes the subject whenever asked to demonstrate his violin skills.

relationships.description: Desperately seeks her hand in marriage, though she has no time for him

npcs.name: Edgar Wyrmspittle
npcs.title: Herbalist
npcs.description: A shaven-headed human man in his fifties, with arched brows, a silver ring in his ear, and a long pipe of Mogglemoss in his lips. Sports a forked beard and dangling moustaches. Dresses in genteel tweed and a burgundy velvet smoking jacket.
npcs.dress: Genteel tweed and burgundy velvet smoking jacket
demeanor: friendly with those who display an interest in the wild herbs and fungi of Dolmenwood
npcs.mannerisms: Raises one eyebrow sceptically, long pipe in lips
npcs.speech: Smooth, erudite bass. Waxes technical. Woldish, Old Woldish.
desires: Unusual herbs or fungi—pays well (75% of listed price)
The distillation secrets of the Brewmasters

known_topics.content: Wyrmspittle raises an eyebrow sceptically. 'Herbal consultations, mushrooms, alchemical compounds. I pay well for unusual specimens—seventy-five percent of listed price.'
His expression softens. 'Ah, you have an interest in the wild herbs and fungi of Dolmenwood? Then we shall get along splendidly. The forest holds countless secrets.'

secret_info.content: Wyrmspittle desperately seeks the distillation secrets of the Brewmasters, which they guard jealously.
secret_info.hint: He occasionally makes pointed inquiries about brewing techniques and special ingredients.

npcs.name: Reverend Mother Liane Smunk
npcs.title: Vicar of Prigwort
npcs.description: A plump, rosy-cheeked human woman in her forties, with prematurely white hair tied in a neat bun. Has one orange, goat-like eye. Dresses in white robes embroidered with vine-like patterns of gold thread, dotted with beads of yellow glass.
npcs.dress: White robes embroidered with vine-like patterns of gold thread, dotted with beads of yellow glass
desires: To send a mission to the High Wold, seeking shorthorn initiates to the clergy
secrets: Has breggle blood in her ancestry

known_topics.content: Mother Smunk beams with radiant cheerfulness. 'Welcome, dear child! The Church of St Waylaine offers blessings to all who pray. Do come in!'
She clasps her hands hopefully. 'I dream of sending a mission to the High Wold, seeking shorthorn initiates to the clergy. Wouldn't that be wonderful?'

secret_info.content: The Reverend Mother has breggle blood in her ancestry, which explains her one orange, goat-like eye.
secret_info.hint: She avoids discussing her family history and is oddly sympathetic to breggle visitors.

triggers.npc_response: Fellow servants of the saints! How wonderful to meet kindred spirits!

npcs.name: Mostlemyre Drouge
npcs.title: Consulting Magician
npcs.description: A fat human man in his late 50s, with a shaven head and pudgy, clammy hands clad with bejewelled rings (one of which is enchanted). Dresses in purple silks with an octagonal orange skullcap and a curious pair of thick, prismatic lensed spectacles.
npcs.dress: Purple silks with octagonal orange skullcap and thick, prismatic lensed spectacles
demeanor: forthright and businesslike in his dealings with strangers
has a general liking for adventurers, taking roguish antics with a pinch of salt
npcs.speech: Dawdling baritone. Woldish, Old Woldish, several obscure otherworldly tongues.
desires: Spells, tomes, and magic items related to scrying and other dimensions
Seeks a copy of the infamous tome of summoning magic, the Black Book of Llareggub
secrets: Elder brother of Elevated Sirrop Drouge
House Oberon spirits rumoured enhanced by his magic

known_topics.content: Mostlemyre smiles enigmatically. 'Detect Magic, deciphering inscriptions, identification of enchanted items. My rates are quite reasonable for those who bring interesting work.'
His eyes gleam with interest. 'Scrying, other dimensions, planar magic—these are my specialties. Do you have any tomes or items relating to such matters?'
He chuckles warmly. 'I do enjoy the tales of adventurers. Roguish antics, narrow escapes—tell me of your exploits.'

secret_info.content: Mostlemyre desperately seeks a copy of the infamous Black Book of Llareggub, a tome of summoning magic.
secret_info.hint: He makes pointed inquiries about any ancient books adventurers might have encountered.

secret_info.content: It is rumored that House Oberon's spirits are enhanced by Mostlemyre's magic. He is the elder brother of Elevated Sirrop Drouge.
secret_info.hint: House Oberon's brews have an unusual quality that some attribute to magical enhancement.

npcs.name: Blino Jongle
npcs.title: Clashed Antler Proprietor
npcs.description: An elderly human man, once proud and strong-backed, now doddery and enfeebled. His bald pate is dotted with liver spots and his spit-soaked grey moustaches hang limply down to his chest. Dresses in a shabby black suit.
demeanor: will not have a bad word said about his great-nephew Austache
looks on in silent reproach during debauches, fretfully hand-wringing and chewing moustaches
desires: To find a good, dependable woman for Austache to settle down with or, failing that, a strict employer to keep him out of trouble

known_topics.content: Blino's voice wavers. 'The Clashed Antler... been in my family for generations. Lodging, food, and our famous Bundt cake twice weekly—free to all!'
He wrings his hands. 'My great-nephew Austache is a good lad, truly! Those guards just don't understand him. He only wants to protect the town.'

relationships.description: Great-uncle who raised Austache and refuses to see his faults

npcs.name: Austache Jongle
npcs.title: Vigilante Leader
npcs.description: An awkward, pudgy human man in his early thirties (significantly older than most of his gang), with misty blue eyes and unkempt blonde hair and beard. Dresses in a ridiculous, harlequin patchwork of coloured cloth.
npcs.dress: Ridiculous, harlequin patchwork of coloured cloth
npcs.mannerisms: Shaky hands caused by early-onset alcoholism
desires: To recruit more members to his gang—including adventurous types!—and set up continuous patrols around Prigwort, on the lookout for 'wrong-uns'
npcs.occupation: Leader of Austache's Bounders vigilante gang

known_topics.content: Austache whoops loudly. 'Join Austache's Bounders! We patrol the woods, keep the town safe from wrong-uns. Adventure! Excitement! Free drinks!'
He gestures dramatically with shaky hands. 'Crookhorns and monsters in the woods! Only the Bounders stand between Prigwort and doom!'

relationships.description: Great-nephew who runs the vigilante gang from his uncle's inn
The captain suspects the Bounders of criminal activity and seeks to arrest Austache

entries.description: A pedlar bearing bags of fresh herbs to Wyrmspittle's.
One of Mostlemyre Drouge's enigmatic black-wreathed servitors running errands around town.
1d3 Brewmasters overseeing transport of a giant vat of liquid to the Town Hall.
Hague Jerricorn arguing with a raggedy sailor over the authenticity of an old map she is clutching.
Captain Hogwash loudly leading wagon-loads of stone to the construction site beside the Abbey Gate.
Dozens of locals bearing the insignia of one of the noble brewing houses, rolling kegs through the streets.
2d3 town guards dragging 1d4 protesting youths (members of Austache's Bounders) to the gaol.
Austache and 2d4 gang members drunkenly accosting 1d4 shorthorn travellers on their way to the Oaf in the Oast for a soothing bath.
A Brewmaster surreptitiously reading a note written in glowing golden Sylvan script (from the Earl of Yellow, promising a shipment of 'languid evermore').
1d6 revellers singing the praises of Maydrid Hydball, whom they all profess their undying love for.
Brash war horns ring out in the woods as a troop of 3d6 crookhorns harries 1d6 lost pilgrims.
